result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maryann Herrera

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Maryann Herrera appeared by video.  Attorney Maryann Corea appeared by video for Maryann Herrera.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  State advised Court that a DPA offer was extended.  If defendant does not accept DPA at final pretrial conference, state will revoke offer.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Maryann Herrera in court with attorney Maryann Corea.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
OFF THE RECORD:  Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests additional status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.  Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 8.01.22
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 08/01/22

Court ordered no contact with TMR (11/4/78)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

ADDRESS INFO for Maryann Herrera

Prior: 3152 South 27th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Maryann Herrera in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Maryann Herrera in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Maryann Herrera appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
